results.title: The Australian National University
results.creator_credit: John Morris, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Surveys the teaching and research facilities of the Australian National University. Shows examples of investigations being pursued in microbiology, botany, geophysics, English, law, archaeology, Indonesian, literature, zoology, demography, astronomy, and political science. Photography: Tom Cowan; Music: Moneta Eagles.

results.title: The Australian National University
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The National University in Canberra opened in 1946 is a University new in foundation and purpose. It is for post graduate studies only, and the work undertaken there is on projects related to original research designed to add to the sum of human knowledge. There are four research schools connected with medical research, physical sciences, Pacific studies and social sciences. The purpose of the University is to allow concentration on research and by so doing attract some of the best brains to remain in Australia instead of going to research centres overseas.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 136
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Four generations: Golden Jubilee of War Veteran’s Homes; four generations of ex-servicemen have benefited from this service. Camp Southern Cross: International camp is one of the activities held throughout the world to celebrate the Diamond Jubilee Of Guiding. Held at Britannia Park, in the Dandenongs, Vic. January 1970. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian lizards
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the five families of lizards found in Australia: goannas, dragons, skinks, geckoes and legless lizards. Illustrates the differences in size, shape, colour and pattern. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.description: A comprehensive survey of the five families of lizards found in Australia: goannas, dragons, skinks, geckoes and legless lizards. Illustrates the differences in size, shape, colour and pattern. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Australian football: fitness, skill, sportsmanship
results.creator_credit: Bruce Andrew, Fulton Muir, Jack Hamilton, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Depicts important points of play in Australian Football and the need for fitness and training; excerpts from the 1969 Victorian Grand Final and the Interstate Football Carnival in Adelaide in 1969. Commentary by Brian Naylor.

results.title: Australian football
results.creator_credit: Stanley Moore, Ajax Films and Coca-Cola
results.brief_description: The great Australian game of football - of colorful crowds packing Melbourne Cricket Ground to watch their idols play. Players demonstrate the bounce, recovery, centre bounce, tackling, passing the ball, marking, various types of kick and the finer points of the game to youngsters at school. Includes sequences shot whilst important games were in progress.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 135
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Coleambally irrigation area, N.S.W.: Water has brought good production and harvests to farms which were once barren wildernesses; Albert Park: Five hundred and seventy acres of Melbourne parkland are put to good use; a large lake, parklands, sporting areas, buildings and a restaurant. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 134
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Bush Hostel: the dingo-proof fence which runs along the border of New South Wales, Queensland and South Australia is patrolled and repaired. The Todd family live on the job and the three children have been taught by correspondence but are now able to attend school for the first time. Tea and Sugar Train: Fifty maintenance camps are scattered along the Trans Continental Railway which runs along the Nullabor Plain. Weekly trains bring essential supplies and news to families at these lonely outposts. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 133
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Heron sailing, Canberra. A poetic glimpse of Heron class yachts on Lake Burley Griffin; Pre-school kindergarten. A day at a kindergarten at which many children obviously enjoy facilities available under the supervision of trained staff; Modern dance. At the Fort Street Girls’ High School in Sydney, Modern dance is part of the physical education programme and many students enjoy these sessions. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 132
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Drought, A sheep station in N.S.W. faces ruin because of one of the worst-ever droughts; rain has not fallen for 18 months and water for limited use is brought in by truck. Bundaberg: the Queensland coastal port which serves a rich agricultural area with a near tropical climate and rich volcanic soil. Birth place of the famous airman, Bert Hinkler, it is a prosperous city which thrives on the extensive sugar cane industry. No other credits available.
